196. McMillan, Jean (Mrs.)
THAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name Mrs. Jean MacMillan
Address Conquest
Birthplace Hamota, Man.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? ............... 1906.
Where did you set up housekeeping? ........................................... 28, 29, 39, 47, 53
Where had you been living before that? Hamota, Manitoba
For how many people did you prepare meals? 3
How far was it to your nearest store? ............................................ 5 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? .................................. 1908
What groceries did you usually buy in those earlier years?
Sugar, salt, tea, flour, fruit, yeast, cakes, molasses, oil, onions

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Royal Household
In what quantities did you buy it? 6 months quantity
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $2.00 - $2.50
How much did you use graham flour? 1/2 lb.
Whole wheat flour? ..............................
Was flour milled locally? Yes, how far away? 4 miles, what year? .......
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 40¢
What other grain products did you use? Cracked wheat
Cornmeal? ...................... Whole wheat? ................ Farina? ............
Other? ..................................................
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Some cracked wheat
How did you grind it? Crushed was used for cracked wheat

4. **DAILY PROVISIONS**

Butter? [Homemade. Butter was scarce.]

5. **MEAT AND FISH**

What was your meat supply in the early years?

How did you get fresh meat? [Killed own animals.]

How often did you eat fresh meat? [Weekly.]

How did you preserve meat? [Cured.]

Was there a "meat ring" in your neighborhood? [Yes.]

If so, what was it organized? [Meat ring.]

Did you use formal? [Yes.]

For how long? [One year.]

What part did fish play in the daily diet? [Main course.]

Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? [Fresh.]

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

Breakfast: porridge toast + butter or homemade jam sometimes 1923.
Dinner: potatoes meat or eggs + veg - if we had them
milk puddings or custard pie + dried fruit pie
Supper: left over potatoes, eggs dried fruit or apples
Had lots of variety after fall of 1908.
